turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about AppleCare.
turn.1: What's the difference between Apple Care and regular iPhone/iPod support?
turn.2: Additionally, buying AppleCare+ for iPods and other iOS devices can extend both support and hardware to two years.
turn.3: Does the Apple Watch have extended support?
turn.4: Extended coverage under the Protection Plan is available for the Apple Watch for either two or three years, depending on the particular model of the device.
turn.6: The AppleCare Protection Plan extends the complimentary 90-day coverage to three years from the original device purchase date for Mac or Apple displays and two years from the given device's purchase date for iPads, iPhones, iPods, or Apple TV devices.
turn.7: Does the plan cover theft and loss?
turn.8: Theft and loss coverage is only provided in Japan and the United States of America.
turn.9: What is the deductible for an iPhone?
turn.10: AppleCare+ with theft and loss includes up to two incidences of accidental damage, theft or loss coverage at a reduced cost to the end consumer.
turn.11: Is the plan available in other countries?
turn.12: Currently Theft and Loss coverage is unavailable in Europe, South America, Asia Pacific, Africa North America (Canada) or Antartica.
